column1: Asino (Russian: А́сино) is a town and the administrative center of Asinovsky District in Tomsk Oblast
column5: 471 (1989 Census). It was previously known as Kseniyevsky (until 1930).

column1: It was founded in 1896 as the transmigratory settlement of Kseniyevsky (Ксениевский); in 1930 the construction of the railway to Tomsk started. The settlement was renamed Asino in 1930 after the railway station
column2: and the town status was granted to it in 1952.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Asino serves as the administrative center of Asinovsky District
column3: to which it is directly subordinated. As a municipal division
column4: the town of Asino is incorporated within Asinovsky Municipal District as Asinovskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: There is a port on the Chulym River and a railway station.

column5: the area also has combines (meat and milk) and a flax mill.

column1: Agriculture in Asino in dominated by rye
column4: and breeding cattle and pigs. Mineral deposits of peat
column6: and clay are found in the vicinity.
